lead_paragraph: SCHECHTER--Loren. January 31, 1942 - April 22, 2016. Loren Schechter of Forest Hills and Old Chatham, New York passed away peacefully surrounded by his family and friends on Friday, April 22, 2016 after an extended illness. A life-long New Yorker, Loren graduated from the Bronx High School of Science, City College and New York University School of Law. Loren was a recognized securities law expert beginning his legal career at the New York Stock Exchange before joining the legal department of E.F. Hutton and subsequently becoming General Counsel of Prudential Securities Group. After leaving Prudential Securities, Loren entered private practice as a partner at Kirkpatrick & Lockhart and then Duane Morris where he led the firm's broker-dealer practice. A past president of the Compliance and Legal Division of the Securities Industry Association, Loren was awarded the Alfred J. Rauschman Memorial Award in 2013. Loren will be remembered by his colleagues and clients for not only providing expert legal counsel but for the guidance, mentorship, and friendship he offered. Nothing was more important to Loren than his family and friends. He is survived by his beloved wife of 53 years Joanne (nee Novod), loving children Gail Schechter and Linda Schechter Manley (Michael), adored grandchildren Zachary, Heather, Ethan and Tyler, loyal dog Judy, cherished brothers-in-law Lewis Novod (Sheila) and Elliot Upton, as well as countless friends. In lieu of flowers, the family has requested donations to be made in Loren's memory to NYU Langone Medical Center in recognition of Drs. Frank O'Brien, Sheetal Desai-Oghraand, and Anna Marissa Araw. Funeral services will be held on Monday, April 25, 2016 at 12 noon at Riverside Memorial Chapel, 180 W. 76th St., New York, NY and the family will sit Shiva in their home. 1/3
